dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.2.3200

idCitation.resTitle: 2010 U.S. Census TIGER Roads Address Ranges Relationships Table

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Statewide version of the address range relationship tables for the 2010 U.S. Census TIGER Roads.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This table represents a significantly processed version of the address range relationship tables provided for each county: tl_2010__addr.dbf. It contains all of the address ranges and address numbers associated with 2010 TIGER segments, including those that can not be contained within the "most inclusive" range stored in the TIGER roads attribute table itself.Some examples of these are segments with addresses associated with more than one zipcode and address numbers with non-numeric characters. A full explanation of the address range relationship file can be found here: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/tgrshp2010/TGRSHP10C6.pdf.

All county files for Massachusetts were initially merged into this single table. This resulted in a table with 677,072 records. But this table was not suitable for geocoding with standard locator service templates in the latest version of ArcGIS (ArcMap 10, SP1). The most appropriate template for dealing with address ranges requires a LEFTFROM, LEFTTO, RIGHTFROM, and RIGHTTO set of fields; each field inherently contains information about which side of the segment the address number exists on. But the schema of the address range relationship table has a FROMHN number field, a TOHN number field, and a SIDE field that specifies left (L) or right (R). The same problem exists with the zipcode field (ZIP). To solve this, the requisite set of fields were created in the table, as well as left and right town fields to store additional zone information. The TOWNL and TOWNR fields were populated by joining back to the TIGER roads on the unique TLID segment ID and transferring the information there. The address ranges and zipcode were allocated via the use of a Python script.

The Python script performed checks of the SIDE field to see which pair of FROM/TO fields should receive the range information associated with each record. But this would normally result in a lot of wasted table space with NULL values associated with the other FROM/TO fields for that same record. So additional functionality was added to consolidate records, transferring address ranges between records sharing the same TLID value where each had an address range on opposing sides of the segment, and deleting the record that had its values moved. Values in different records that exist on the same side of a given segment were not consolidated, so as not to eliminate gaps between ranges that were intentional. Also, any address number containing a non-numeric symbol was kept intact and not transferred, as it is not readily apparent which destination record is the most suitable. This process resulted in nearly a 45% decrease in records in the final table without losing any of the information necessary for geocoding. (information pertaining to address ranges using imputed values was lost in the process however).

As of the writing of this document, there does not exist an ArcMap geocoding locator service template that allows for the creation of a locator that makes use of both an alias street name table and a related address range table simultaneously. MassGIS is pursuing the development of such a template, though there is no estimated timetable on its release.

Consts.useLimit: There are no access and use limitations for this table.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: ZIP Code on the left side of the street
ZIP Code on the right side of the street
City/town name on the left side of the street
City/town name on the right side of the street
